rooms.name: Dead End
rooms.description: You look about and find yourself enclosed in a small room.  The door that you just came through appears to be your only exit from this dark room.  Upon closer examination, you see that the walls were cut straight out of the earth, and they reek of the undead.  It is so cold in this room that your limbs begin to get sore.

East.description: You see an outline of a door in the east wall.

South.description: You see a door in the south wall that you hadn't noticed before.

rooms.name: Secret Closet
rooms.description: You are now standing in a small closet just north of the main stairwell. The closet seems recently used, for there isn't a speck of dust anywhere.  A deep sense of coldness is coming from the west wall.  Discarded weapons and armor lay about this room, and they smell of the undead.  It seems as if the necromancer has more tricks up his sleeve than you thought.

South.description: You see a door set in the south wall.

West.description: You see an outline of a door in the west wall.

rooms.name: Hoard Room
rooms.description: You walk into a glorious room, untouched for centuries on end.  Everything seems to glow with a pale blue light, and you feel safe.  In the back of the room you notice a small hoard of items, guarded by a powerful spectre.  You feel attracted to items that he is guarding.  It seems that this is the soul of the individual who was originally buried at this mausoleum, and he has come here to protect his possessions.  Over the years, he has increased in power, and is now a mighty force that you should not mess with.

South.description: A beautiful hallway sits to your south.

rooms.name: Skull Room
rooms.description: You walk into this room and you are forced to hold your stomach.  Piles and piles of human bones lay against the wall, and it smells of rotting flesh. You wonder why on earth you are here, and wish you were back in a nice soft bed in the reception area.  This seems to be the stockpile of corpses kept by the necromancer to feed his undead servants.  A small door lies in wall to the south.

North.description: You see a small door in the north wall.

South.description: You push the skulls aside to find a small door that you can crawl through.

rooms.name: Main Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing directly under the entrance to the mausoleum.  From what you can see, someone or something has created a rather intricate tunnel system for whatever reason.  As you look around, the walls seem to enclose about you, and you begin to feel claustrophobic.  You turn to look down the stairwell, and a deep sense of evil pulsates through your being.  You shudder to think what could be down there.

North.description: You see a door in the north wall.

Up.description: You see a small trapdoor leading up the entrance of the mausoleum.

Down.description: You look but can't see anything because it so dark.

rooms.name: Dim Passageway
rooms.description: As you move deeper into this secret area, you feel an increasing sense of good.  You feel at ease as warmth flows from the north.  The passageway is dimly lit, and well furnished with pictures on the wall, and carpeting.  The abundance of dust indicates that this area was untouched, even by the necromancer.  Perhaps he could never find it.

North.description: You see the spectre's hoard room to your north.

South.description: You see a bend in the passageway leading out of this secret area.

rooms.name: Dark Staircase
rooms.description: You are standing at the top of a deathly dark staircase.  The only exit that you can find is down, for the door that you just came through in the north wall has ceased to exist from your view.  The smell from the bone room no longer seems to be here, as you smell an unfamiliar scent from the bottom of the staircase.  Curiosity builds as you realize that this area appears to be well used.

North.description: A small door is the wall to the north.

East.description: You feel the edges of a door in the east wall.

Down.description: You attempt to peer down below, but your eyes cannot adjust to the lack of light.

rooms.name: Secret Passageway
rooms.description: As you walk through the wall, the deep sense of evil that has been bothering you for quite a long time now vanishes.  The passageway seems to be untouched, and perhaps the necromancer never found this area.  You feel comfortable in this dimly lit room, and now feel more confident about yourself.

East.description: The secret passageway continues to the east.

West.description: You see a hefty door in the wall to the west.

rooms.name: Bend in Passageway
rooms.description: You are in a bend in the passageway that leads north and west from here.  A blue light seems to be coming from a distance to the north, and you start to feel drowsy as you take in the comfortable surroundings.  You hope that this safe feeling is for real, because if anything were to attack you, you'd definitely be off guard.

North.description: A sense of good emanates from the passageway to the north.

West.description: You see the entrance to this secret area.

rooms.name: Moist Bend
rooms.description: You are standing inside a bend in a moist passageway, opening east into the stairwell leading into the depths, and south into another length of the moist passageway.  You notice holes in the walls, which bleed a putrid ooze.  You sense that this place is evil and filled with the animated and undead. Somehow you will gain the courage to go on.

East.description: You see a stairwell.

South.description: The moist hallway continues to the south.

rooms.name: Moist Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the top of a damp staircase, leading down.  You hear echoes and sounds of pain and suffering coming from below.  A wretched flow of air comes from the darkness, and you must struggle to keep your lunch from coming up.  You can go down or west from here.

West.description: You see a hallway leading back the way you came.

Down.description: You cannot adjust your eyes to the lack of light.  You see nothing.

rooms.name: North Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing on another staircase directly north of the main stairwell. You wonder if you will get lost among this framework of tunnels and stairwells. It seems that the necromancer has done this to trap any wandering fools, such that his servants can feed on their corpses.  You can go down into the depths of the this area, or go back south to the main stairwell.

South.description: You see the main stairwell of this underground maze.

Down.description: You see a well-lit passageway below you.

rooms.name: Moist Passageway
rooms.description: You are now standing in a damp passageway that has little light.  You can feel every gland on your body releasing sweat as you begin to become drenched from head to toe.  Your begin to feel quite uncomfortable, and feel that the quicker you move on, the better.  Screams of terror echoes through the passageways, and you feel the walls closing in on you.  You can go north or south from here.

North.description: The moist passageway continues to the north.

South.description: The moist passageway stretches off to the south.

rooms.name: West Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the top of yet another staircase leading into the depths of darkness.  All light seems to be sucked away as you peer down the slope. Even the main stairwell itself to your east provides more comfort that this wretched place.  Upon closer examination of the darkness, you notice shapes shifting back and forth, and slight screams from the distance echo in your head.  Kryzanthor seems to have done a good job creating this place to fill the human mind with terror.

East.description: You see the main stairwell of this underground maze.

Down.description: Your eyes cannot adjust to the lack of light.  All you can see is that the passageway is extraordinarily dark.

rooms.name: Main Stairwell
rooms.description: You are now standing a ways under the entrance to the mausoleum.  A faint hint of light comes from above, and leaves you with a little bit of hope. That seems to fade quickly as you realize your situation, and the incredible stench of the undead permeates your being.  Screams of hatred and dismay come from the depths.  You close your hands to your ears, and close your eyes as you try to relieve yourself from the incredible terror.

North.description: You see the northern stairwell leading into the depths.

East.description: You see another stairwell, although this one gives hints of light.

South.description: You see a stairwell leading far underground.

West.description: You see a stairwell that is completely devoid of light leading into the depths.

Up.description: You look up and see the entrance to this maze.

rooms.name: East Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing directly east of the main stairwell to the tunnels.  As you look down the staircase, you see a faint sense of light, and a small hope fills your mind.  That disappears as the familiar stench of the undead knocks you back.  You vow that you'll show Kryzanthor the same terror he is showing you. You can go down towards death, or back west to the main stairwell.

West.description: You see the main stairwell to this underground tunnel system.

Down.description: You look down to see a hint of light coming from a passageway.

rooms.name: Moist Bend
rooms.description: It seems as if this personal hell will never end as your body becomes even more drenched with sweat.  All light is gone from the room, and a bad feeling is climbing up your spine.  Even the walls are wet and slimy from the incredible humidity.  To make it worse, the familiar smell of rotting flesh is ever so strong.

North.description: This disgusting hallway stretches off to the north.

East.description: You see the dark staircase that you came from.

rooms.name: Dark Staircase
rooms.description: Standing at the bottom of a dark staircase, a mortal terror creeps into your soul, for you begin to realize that Kryzanthor might actually have some evil thing in store for you.  Could you possibly defeat a necromancer powerful enough to create all of this?  You shove those thoughts out of your mind as you push on.  You can go up or west into the increasing darkness.

West.description: Looking west you catch a waft of disgusting, humid air.  It is yet another passageway.

Up.description: Your eyes cannot adjust to the lack of light as you attempt to peer up the staircase.

rooms.name: South Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing on another staircase directly south of the main stairwell. You wonder if you will get lost among this framework of tunnels and stairwells. It seems that the necromancer has done this to trap any wandering fools, such that his servants can feed on their corpses.  You can go down into the depths of the this area, or go back north to the main stairwell.

North.description: You peer north and see the main stairwell to this tunnel system.

Down.description: Looking down the staircase you notice it leads far underground.

rooms.name: Well-Lit Stairwell
rooms.description: You are at the top of a rather well-lit stairwell on the third level of Kryzanthor's tunnels.  You look around to find that the light source that is rather comforting at the moment a mystery, for you cannot determine the source of it.  It seems as if all the walls just glow in an iridescent hue.  >From here you can go down the staircase, or east into the passageway.

East.description: This strange hallway continues to the east.

Down.description: You look down well-lit stairwell and see more shapes moving around.

rooms.name: Well-Lit Passageway
rooms.description: Standing in a well-lit passageway, you realize that the source of the light is totally imponderable.  You search for a hidden lantern, or an orb, but you see nothing.  Everything just seems to glow with an eerie iridescence that gives you the chills.  You hope that it does not affect you in any way that would be permanent.  Perhaps Kryzanthor has put them there for the purpose of confusing wandering adventurers.

East.description: You see a bend in the passageway leading back to the main stairwell.

West.description: Looking west you see a stairwell leading down to another level.

rooms.name: Well-Lit Bend
rooms.description: You are standing in the bend of a lighted passageway just north of the northern stairwell.  The passageway is lit in a mysterious manner, for you cannot perceive the source of the illumination.  As usual, the smell of decomposing corpses knocks you back almost out of your shoes.  From here you can go south to the stairwell, or west on into passageway.

South.description: To the south sits a stairwell leading back up to the main stairwell.

West.description: The passageway stretches off to the west.

rooms.name: Sunny Bend
rooms.description: Looking around the bend, you notice that chunks of the wall have been broken down, as if someone were trying to escape.  Although there are holes, it appears that whoever or whatever trying to escape failed, for it is quite impossible for any human or undead to crawl through the holes.  The holes are not completely useless, for beams of sunlight are coming through, providing a small sense of hope among this personal hell provided by the one and only Kryzanthor the necromancer.

East.description: You see sunlight filling yet another similar passageway.

South.description: You see a stairwell leading down.

rooms.name: Sunny Bend
rooms.description: Standing in the bend in a sunny passageway, you sense that you are not alone in this evil place.  You can hear screams and laughter from the depths, and you put your hands to head trying to block out any images of death that permeate your mind.  Chills run down your back as the evil laughter sounds like it is calling your name.  From here you can go south west to another bend, or south into the passageway.

South.description: The sunny passageway leads off to the south.

West.description: You see a bend leading a staircase.

rooms.name: Dark Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the top of an extremely gloomy stairwell leading into the depths of the tunnels.  Sounds of the undead screaming and yelling echo from below, and send a chill up your spine.  A swift air flows below knocking you back because of the horrible stench of decaying human corpses.  The combination of all this stuff is putting you out of your mind, and you personally would rather be in a nice soft bed in the reception area.  From here you can go down into the depths, or east to the moist stairwell.

East.description: You see a stairwell leading back up the way you came.

Down.description: A sense of power emanates from below as you look down the stairwell.

rooms.name: Moist Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of an extremely humid stairwell.  The walls drip with a slimy ooze that does not look natural of any sort.  Every gland in your body starts to sweat.  To your west you see an extremely dark staircase from which a source of evil permeates.  You can go west into the darkness, or back up the moist stairwell.

West.description: The stairwell to your west leads further into the depths.

Up.description: The stairwell leads back up the way came.

rooms.name: North Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of the north stairwell, just off of the main staircase.  Looking around you begin to understand the structure of the tunnels.  They actually seem to have some symmetry about them, so Kryzanthor could keep track of his servants easier.  The staircases are setup in a NSEW structure about the main staircase, and each one goes down into deeper tunnels. From here you can go back up the staircase, or north in the a dimly-lit tunnel.

North.description: A well-lit passageway begins north of here.

Up.description: The top of this stairwell leads back to the main stairwell.

rooms.name: Sunny Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the top of a sun-filled stairwell.  Beams of sunlight hit your forehead, yet you still feel cold all the way to your soul.  The sunlight is dampened when you are knocked back by the familiar stench of rotting corpses and the undead.  From here you can go down towards death, or north into a sun-lit passageway.

North.description: The sunny passageway leads off to the north.

Down.description: You hear more sounds of dragons as you direct your attention towards the stairwell.

rooms.name: Sunny Passageway
rooms.description: You are standing amidst a million rays of sunlight peeping through small holes in the wall.  It seems as if the walls have either decayed or been broken down my someone or something.  You are glad to see sunlight for the first time in a long while, but that hope is only superficial, for the realization of your true danger sits heavily on your mind.  The screams of terror just make this place all the more pleasant.  Looking about you, you see that there are bends to both the north and south of you.

North.description: The sunny passage continues to the north.

South.description: The sunny passage continues to the south.

rooms.name: Black Bend
rooms.description: Standing in a horribly dark room, you begin to lose your orientation and balance.  Your light source provides little help in this place, for with its help you can barely see your hand in front of your face.  It seems that Kryzanthor put all of his effort into making this place as wretched as he could.  From feeling the walls and such, you determine that you can go east to a stairwell, or south into more darkness.

East.description: You see the western stairwell.

South.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: West Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of the western stairwell, just under the main staircase.  You look around and fear is struck into your soul as you realize that you are not alone.  Dark shapes are moving from shadow to shadow, and you can hear inhuman grunts and snarls.  You shudder at the thought of something grabbing hold of you and making you its dinner.  From what you can see, you can go back up the stairwell, or west into the utter darkness.

West.description: Darkness looms to the west.

Up.description: The main stairwell is at the top of the staircase.

rooms.name: Hidden Staircase
rooms.description: You are standing in a staircase used only by the necromancer and death knight.  It is unknown to any of his servants, except his body guard.  As you come from below, the trapdoor closes shut and disappears.  The only way out is to proceed upwards.  You look up and see light coming from above.

Up.description: You see the familiar main stairwell when you look upwards.

rooms.name: East Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of the eastern stairwell.  You look around you and see a hint of light coming from the passageway to the east.  This gives you some hope, but then again that is destroyed as the ever familiar smell of decaying corpses knocks you back.  You fear of what may be in store for you as you venture through the forgotten tunnels of Kryzanthor.

East.description: The sunny passageway begins east of here.

Up.description: You see light a small hint of light as you look up the stairwell.

rooms.name: Sunny Bend
rooms.description: You are standing directly east of the bottom of the eastern stairwell. Looking about, you find a superficial hope in sunlight coming through cracks and holes in the walls.  It is the first hint of sunlight that you have seen in a long time, and are glad to see it.  Unfortunately, the screams of dismay and the evil laughter have not ceased, so it is virtually impossible to have any real hope in a place so horrible.  From here you can go north into the passageway, or back west to the staircase.

North.description: The passageway continues to the north.

West.description: The stairwell leading out of this passageway sits to your west.

rooms.name: Black Passageway
rooms.description: You are totally confused as you walk into this room, because everything seems to look the same in total darkness.  Human eyes just don't have the ability to see things in the dark, and that was Kryzanthor's purpose in making a place so miserable.  You back yourself against the wall to reorient yourself and you finally convince yourself that you can go either north or south from here.

North.description: It's too dark too see!

South.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: Black Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the top of an incredibly dark staircase, completely devoid of light.  If it weren't for your light source, you'd stumble down the steps.  You examine the darkness as best you can, and notice shapes shifting back and forth, throwing fear into your being.  You vow that you will get revenge on Kryzanthor for this terror that he has provided you with.

South.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: South Stairwell
rooms.description: You are at the bottom of the southern stairwell, just under the main staircase.  Screams of terror and dismay from the undead are echoing through the halls, and fear climbs in your heart.  The smell of the undead and rotting corpses is starting to get to you as you get deeper into the tunnel system of Kryzanthor.

South.description: You see the beginning of the underground passageway.  You are now far underneath the surface of the graveyard.

Up.description: You see a large stairwell leading back out of the depths.

rooms.name: Underground Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the top of a stairwell leading into the depths of Kryzanthor's tunnels.  Sharpening your ears towards the depths, you hear evil laughter and howls coming from the undead waiting for you to become their dinner.  Not only do you hear the undead, but you smell them, for they reek of something so horrible that you can horribly stand the smell.  From here you can go down into the tunnels, or east into the passageway.

East.description: You look east and see a passageway you came from.

Down.description: This stairwell leads even further into the depths.

rooms.name: Underground Bend
rooms.description: You are standing in a bend in the passageway just east of the underground stairwell.  Your stomach is really starting to get to you as the smell of the undead and decomposing corpses just won't leave you.  The screams from the Kryzanthor's servants don't help either.  Their screams echo throughout the halls, and almost sound as if they are saying your name.  You wouldn't doubt that the necromancer has magic powerful enough to do such a thing.

South.description: The passageway continues to the south.

West.description: You see a stairwell leading deeper into the tunnels.

rooms.name: Black Bend
rooms.description: Standing at the very corner of the tunnels, you begin to feel excruciatingly lonely.  The darkness just makes you lose any purpose in life, for all you want to do now is get out alive.  You had heard stories about this place, but never had you imagined what it was really like.  You pray to your deity that Kryzanthor is not that formidable of a foe, but somehow you wouldn't bet on it. From here you can go east or north.

North.description: It's too dark to see!

East.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: Black Bend
rooms.description: Standing directly south of the dark staircase, you hope that you get out of such a sorrowful place.  It seems that the quicker you get out the better, for if you stay in here much longer you'll go insane.  There is only so much terror that a single adventurer can handle.  Built upon this terror is the fact that you are here out of greed for artifacts and useful items.  None of these are important if you die.

North.description: It's too dark to see!

West.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: Underground Bend
rooms.description: You are standing directly south of the southern stairwell of Kryzanthor's tunnels.  You look about you and see ominous signs of the undead.  Not only can you see shapes moving in the dark, but the stench from them leaves no doubt in your mind that you are not alone.  Looking to the east you see that the passageway continues on, and to the north is yet another stairwell.

North.description: You see the south stairwell leading back up to the main stairwell.

East.description: This underground passageway stretches off to the east.

rooms.name: Underground Passageway
rooms.description: As you walk into this room, you get an eerie feeling that you are not alone. The walls themselves are slimy and drip with ooze.  It is almost as if the darkness were alive, and ready to attack at any minute.  Being fully alert has tired you out, and you sure that a rest at the inn will be well needed when you return to town, if you ever do.  From here you can go east and west to bends in the passageway.

East.description: Peering east you see more of the same passageway you're in.

West.description: To the west lies the beginning of this underground passageway.

rooms.name: Underground Bend
rooms.description: Standing in this bend in the passageway, you begin to realize what mortal danger you are actually in.  Surrounded by Kryzanthor and his servants doesn't give much hope as far as surviving is concerned.  Let's hope that he doesn't have too many tricks up his sleeve for you, because it would be bad if you were to die.  You look about you and see that you can go north to another bend, or back west into the passageway.

North.description: You see a bend leading to another stairwell.

West.description: The passageway stretches out before you to the west.

rooms.name: Well-Lit Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of a well-lit stairwell, but the source of the luminescence is a mystery.  You search about and find no torches or anything else.  Screams of terror are excruciatingly close as you stand at the bottom of this staircase.  The entire area reeks of the undead, and you really don't want to be here.  You can go east into darkness, or back up the stairwell.

East.description: You see a room designed specifically to house the undead.

Up.description: The stairwell leads back up to a well-lit passageway.

rooms.name: Heucuva Chamber
rooms.description: You walk into a room with shackles on every wall.  Corpses line the walls of unfortunate individuals who have ventured here in the past.  The smell of them make you cringe as your head starts to spin.  As you look closer, you notice that the corpses eyes and guts have been eaten out.  You wonder what disgusting perversion of nature lives here.

West.description: You see a stairwell leading away from this evil room.

rooms.name: Dracolich Chamber
rooms.description: You walk into a room that is used by Kryzanthor to keep his animated servants.  As you look into the shadows of this room, incredibly large shapes are hunched over on their hind legs.  You realize with a mortal terror that you are standing in front of twenty feet tall Dracoliches!  Their claws are 6 inches in length, and their teeth drip with acid waiting to bite into some unexpecting prey.

East.description: You see a passageway leading away from this evil room.

rooms.name: Deep Sunny Bend
rooms.description: You are standing in a bend in the passageway that is surprisingly light. It seems as if a portion of the wall has been knocked out, and rays of sunlight can be seen shining through.  The holes in the wall are too small for any human or undead to crawl through.  As you peer closer towards the west you notice rather large lurking figures in the darkness.  You can go west or south from the this room.

South.description: The passageway curves around to the south.

West.description: Humungous figures loom in the darkness.

rooms.name: Dark Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of an incredibly dark staircase.  Never before has the terror been greater than now, for a great power of evil is emanating from the south.  What is stranger, is that the familiar smell of rotting corpses is now gone, and that gives you a small sense of hope, but that soon disappears as you remember the evil creeping up your spine.  You begin to sweat, and you realize how moist this area really is.

South.description: A horrible sense of evil is flowing from the passageway to your south.

Up.description: The stairwell would let you back the way you came.

rooms.name: Sunny Stairwell
rooms.description: For once in a long time, you see a small light peeping from around the corner of the passageway.  At the bottom of a large staircase, you notice that the light is actually rays of sunlight being reflected on the walls of the passageway.  Even though it is somewhat heartening to see sunlight, fear still fills your mind as the screams of agony and dismay continue to echo through the halls of Kryzanthor.  You can go up the stairwell or east into the passageway.

East.description: The deep sunny passageway curves around to the east.

Up.description: This stairwell climbs back towards another sunny passageway.

rooms.name: Deep Sunny Bend
rooms.description: As you go deeper into this passageway, a sense of power comes from the north, and you hope that it will not be directed towards you.  Any hope created from the appearing sunlight has been obliterated from the utter terror forced upon you from the cries of the undead.  Even though sun is shining on your forehead, it is quite cold down in these tunnels.  Kryzanthor sure has made it rough on wandering adventurers.  From here you can go either west or north.

North.description: The passageway curves to the north.

West.description: You see a stairwell leading up.

rooms.name: Deep Moist Bend
rooms.description: As you walk deeper into the tunnels, you can sense of the power of Kryzanthor getting closer and closer.  Although you can feel his evil, another evil also permeates the area that perplexes you for quite a while.  This power is coming directly from the east as you realize that you are soaked with sweat all over from the incredible humidity.  The bend itself is barren and looks unused, but for a few footprints.  From the footprints you can decipher that two people use this area.

North.description: A stairwell leading out of the wretched place lies to your north.

East.description: Not only is it too dark to see to the east, but you feel the presence of an evil being.

rooms.name: Death Chamber
rooms.description: You walk into a room well furnished for the living of a servant of Kryzanthor.  This is the room of his personal bodyguard, the death knight.  It seems as if the necromancer treats his closest servants well, for the death knight has everything an undead would ever want.  The walls are covered with tapestries of his past life, and the floor is stained with blood from previous adventurers who have wandered this way.

East.description: A horrible source of evil emanates from the east.

West.description: The passageway to the west leads back out of this wretched place.

rooms.name: Kryzanthor's Quarters
rooms.description: You are now standing in the personal quarters of the master of this area. Apparatuses fill this room used to create the undead.  A small cot is in the corner of the room, which looks to be well used.  Many dismembered skeletons and corpses are lying around waiting to be used by the necromancer to create more servants.  An incredible power emanates all around you, and you really hope that your life is not about to end.

West.description: You see the living quarters of Kryzanthor's personal bodyguard.

Up.description: You see a small trapdoor above you.

rooms.name: Deep Black Bend
rooms.description: Even with the use of your light source, you can hardly see a foot in front of you.  The walls suck in all the light, and your mind is in a state beyond fear.  You vow that you will get back at Kryzanthor for this terror that he has been so kind to show you.  Not only is the dark bothering you, but the screams of the undead don't help either.  To the east you can make out a staircase, but the south you can see nothing.

East.description: It's too dark to see!

South.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: Black Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of a very dark staircase.  You put your back against the wall in an attempt to orient yourself, because you can barely see your own hand in front of your face.  You begin to crouch down near the bottom step in fear, but then muster up enough courage to stand and move on. Somehow, you will get out of this place alive.  You can go back up the stairs or west into the darkness.

West.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: Underground Stairwell
rooms.description: You are standing at the bottom of a rather large stairwell, and it appears as if you are at the bottom of the tunnels.  In this underground passageway, the air is quite musty, and it is actually difficult to breathe.  The smell of rotting corpses is also doing quite a good job choking you as you hold back your breath.  You can go back up the stairwell, or east into the passageway.

East.description: Deep within the ground you see a passageway leading away.

Up.description: You see a huge staircase leading up.

rooms.name: Deep Underground Bend
rooms.description: Standing in a bend of the underground passageway, fear begins to mount in your soul.  What is coming?  Will you live through this peril, and you wonder if it is really worth all this trouble.  Let's hope that you have the handy dandy scroll of recall if needed.  You can't help thinking how much happier you would be back in a nice soft bed at the reception area.  Mustering up courage, you decide to stay and move on.  From here, you can go west back to the staircase, or south deeper into the passageway.

South.description: The passageway curves to the south.

West.description: You see a stairwell leading out of the depths.

rooms.name: Deep Black Bend
rooms.description: Standing in the bend of a deathly black passageway, you realize how much of an idiot you must be to leave the sunlight.  You pray that you will eventually be able to return the favor to Kryzanthor of the terror that you are encountering.  At least you have a small light source which allows some sort of mobility.  To the east you see shapes moving in the darkness.  You can go east or north from here.

North.description: It's too dark to see!

East.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: Wraith Chamber
rooms.description: You are standing in the chambers of the wraith creatures.  Kryzanthor uses these undead particularly to kill all roaming adventurers who pose a threat to his kingdom.  It seems that at the moment they are being kept in this room for other purposes.  The familiar smell of rotting flesh fills this room.  The only exit is back west into the dark tunnels.

West.description: It's too dark to see!

rooms.name: Wight Chamber
rooms.description: You walk into a room so foul that you can hardly stand being here.  The scent of rotting flesh is unbearable, and you realize that this is where some of Kryzanthor's servants must be kept.  You hope that whatever lives here will leave you alone, for you are not in the mood of dying.  The only exit from this room is back east into the darkness.

East.description: A passageway curves off to the east.

rooms.name: Deep Underground Bend
rooms.description: As you round the final bend of this underground passage, you hear screams and bellows of evil laughter coming from the west.  The laugh is not of any human, or at least not one with blood flowing through its veins.  You see shapes shifting back and forth through the darkness of the tunnel, and you pray to your deity that they are not aggressive towards wandering fools.  You can go north towards the stairs out, or west into the unknown.

North.description: The passageway curves to the north.

West.description: You see a disgusting room designed specifically for housing the undead.

rooms.name: End of Grove
rooms.description: As you walk into the end of the grove, you begin to wonder if it was such a great idea to come here.  Any light that you may have been able to perceive at one time is now gone.  The hedges appear to be towering over you in a menacing manner, and you wonder if they are only hedges.  You sense an invisible source of evil that just pulsates the entire area.  It would be wise to turn back..... If you can.

South.description: The hedges are dark and looming.

extras.text: Standing high above you these hedges block all sunlight from sight.  Your light source is the only illumination.  Glancing about in your frenzy, you spot a small branch poking out from one of the hedges.

You grab ahold of the branch and tug on it.  A small tuft of foliage falls out of place to reveal what looks to be a door hidden behind the hedges. Upon examination of the door you notice it has no keyholes.  Instead it has a small indenture below the handle in the shape of a ring.

rooms.name: A Sunny Alcove
rooms.description: As you squeeze through the hedges you fall a few feet onto a filthy wooden floor.  The hedges behind you close up leaving you no chance of returning to the grove.  Dusting yourself off and standing upright you are met by a steady stream of light bursting through the window in the west wall.  You are forced to shield your eyes at first after having been used to the dark graveyard. This rooms seems somewhat out of place with respect to the rest of the graveyard.  You have a strong suspicion that Kryzanthor is not responsible for such a place of warmth.

Down.description: Brushing the dust aside, you notice one of the floorboards is loose.

extras.text: Brushing the dust aside, you notice one of the floorboards is loose.

rooms.name: Furnished Hallway
rooms.description: You are certain now that this area was not conceived by the evil necromancer.  The walls are lined with a soft cloth that looks to be quite lavish indeed.  The air is warm and fragrant, leaving you overly curious as to where in Caelia you are.  The room would be completely dark if it weren't for an ornate lamp resting on a coffee table no higher than your waist.  The floor is made of an ancient Silvan oak that has held the test of time.  Peering down the hallway you see some sort of sitting room to the west.

West.description: You see a small sitting room to the west.

Up.description: Looking up you realize you are standing underneath a room with a wooden floor.  It looks like one of the floorboards is loose and you can squeeze between the support beams.

rooms.name: A Small Sitting Room
rooms.description: Looking at the layer of dust that has collected on the furniture here you guess that this place has not been used in quite some time.  Against the walls sit a number of couches and chairs that appear to be rather comfortable. Spotting a picture on the wall, it suddenly all makes sense.  It is a picture of a young couple very much in love.  The man in the picture looks a lot like the Spectre, except younger and alive.  The woman you have never seen before, but are rather astounded by her grace and beauty.  Perhaps this area was made by the Spectre himself so that his wife could live in peace away from the turmoil created by the necromancer.

North.description: A small door lies in the north wall.

East.description: You see the entrance hallway to the east.

rooms.name: A Decorated Bedroom
rooms.description: Amazed by the extravagant decorum, you realize your suspicions were true. Standing before you is the ghost of the Spectre's wife.  Even though she is undead she has not lost any of her beauty.  It seems she spends her time in this bedroom created for her by her loving husband.  Standing in the middle of the room is an extravagantly large bed built out of Silvan oak, similar to that of the flooring.  The furniture is also made out of the finest wood Caelia has to offer.  You begin to wonder how a ghost can create all this, but you figure the Spectre has to be a couple centuries old.  The rest of the room is decorated with various arts, perhaps symbolic of the married couple's interests while they were still alive.

South.description: You see a simple door leading out of the room.
